Instance.description: A statistic to be used for Ranked progression. Ranked progression is essentially progress that lets design tune intervals at which events fire. Some of these events can then be tuned to cause a 'Rank Up' or a 'Rank Down'. A Rank Up (or Rank Down) consists of incrementing (or decrementing) the rank level of the stat. At that point we can do things like displaying a screen slam, and showing a notification that the rank up or down has occurred.

Tunable.name: _default_convergence_value
Tunable.description: The value toward which the stat decays.

TunableList.name: _interval_decay_rates
TunableList.description: A list of decay rate overrides. Whenever the value of the stat falls into this range, the decay rate is overridden with the value specified. This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

TunableTuple.description: The interval/decay_override pair.

Tunable.name: decay_override
Tunable.description: The value that the base decay will be overridden with.

TunableTuple.name: interval
TunableTuple.description: The range at which this override will apply. It is inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: _send_telemetry_on_decay_rate_change
Tunable.display: Send Telemetry On Decay Rate Change
Tunable.description: If True, we will send telemetry when this statistic changes its decay rate. By default, we are not sending this telemetry since it's too spammy.

TunableList.name: associated_bucks_types
TunableList.description: A list of bucks types that are associated with this ranked stat. These bucks types may have tuned data that is affected by ranking up/down.

TunableEnum.description: A buck type that is associated with this ranked stat.

Tunable.description: blue value (0-255)

TunableVariant.name: communicable_by_interaction_tag
TunableVariant.description: List of Tag and loot pairs that will trigger if either the actor or target of an interaction has this statistic to give the first loot whose tag matches any tag on the interaction. So you could do one loot for high risk socials, (tagged as such) a different loot for low risk socials (tagged as such) a third loot for high risk object interactions (licking bowl, maybe?), and fourth loot for low risk object interaction 'generically using an object'.

Tunable.description: The decay rate for this stat (per sim minute).

TunableVariant.description: When enabled contains the tuning for delayed decay. Delayed decay is decay that happens if the value of the commodity hasn't changed in some time.

This overrides the base decay, so all decay modifiers will still apply. The ranges are inclusive on the lower bound and exclusive on the upper bound. Overlapping values are not allowed and will behave in an undefined manner.

Tunable.name: npc_decay

TunableList.name: event_data
TunableList.description: The data associated with a specific tuned event. The Key is the event number as tuned in the event intervals. The value is a list of loots to apply when the event occurs and an bool for whether or not to rank up the stat.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The data associated with a tuned event from event_intervals.

TunableList.name: level_down_loot
TunableList.description: A list of loots to apply when the Sim loses enough points to level down.

TunableList.name: loot
TunableList.description: A list of loots to apply when this event happens. This loot is only applied the first time you reach a specific level. If you want the loot applied every time you reach a level (for instance after you decay to a previous level and then regain a level) please use the loot_always tuning.

Tunable.description: The loot to apply.

TunableList.name: loot_always
TunableList.description: This loot is always awarded on level up, regardless of whether or not this level has already been achieved or not. If you want the loot to only be applied the first time you reach a certain level then please use the loot tuning.

Tunable.description: The loot to award on level up.

TunableList.name: loot_always_on_load
TunableList.description: This loot is always awarded when a sim loads with this level.

Tunable.name: rank_up
Tunable.description: If checked then this event will cause the statistic to rank up and all that entails. Currently that will increment the rank count. There should be a rank up entry for each of the levels tuned, except the initial rank. We assume that you don't need to rank into the initial rank. This means you will need one more level tuned than number of rank up events found in this list.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests to run when reaching this level. If the tests don't pass then the value will be set back to min points for the rank before it. This means that the Sim won't be able to make any progress towards the rank with the failed tests.

Tunable.name: tooltip
Tunable.description: The tooltip to display in the UI for each of the event lines. This is to be used for telling the user what loot they are going to get at an individual event.

TunableList.name: event_intervals
TunableList.description: The level boundaries for an event, specified as a delta from the previous value.

Tunable.description: Points required to reach this level.

TunableEnum.name: gallery_load_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When owner of commodity is loaded from the gallery, tune this to determine if commodity should be loaded or not. DONT_LOAD = Don't load statistic when owner is coming from gallery LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT = Load only if statistic is being added to an object. If this statistic is tuned as a linked stat to a state, make sure the state is also marked as gallery persisted. i.e. Statistics like fish_freshness or gardening_groth. Switching on this bit has performance implications when downloading a lot from the gallery. Please discuss with a GPE when setting this tunable. LOAD_ONLY_FOR_SIM = Load only if statistic is being added to a sim. LOAD_FOR_ALL = Always load commodity. This has the same ramifications as LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT if owner is an object.

TunableVariant.name: gameplay_options_test
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, run a GameplayOptions test to see if we can add this statistic.

TunableEnum.name: participant

TunableList.name: initial_loot_for_visible_stat
TunableList.description: A list of loots to apply when the Sim first receives this ranked statistic. NOTE: If the 'visible' field below is set to false (unchecked), then we do NOT support using initial loots. If you need an initial loot on a statistic without 'visible' checked, then whatever system is adding the stat is responsible for adding the loot. We cannot do it here because of an issue where the loot will be reapplied every time we add this statistic, but when it decays to its convergence value we remove the statistic.

Tunable.name: initial_rank
Tunable.description: The offset of the initial rank for this stat in UI. The use case of initial rank is if the display of the stat in UI needs to start with an initial fill (e.g. Occult Tracker), or if the fill first starts as empty (e.g. Fame). Discuss with UI what is required.

Tunable.name: initial_value
Tunable.description: The initial value for this stat.

TunableList.name: min_decay_per_highest_level_achieved
TunableList.display: Min Decay Per Highest Level Achieved
TunableList.description: A mapping of highest level reached to the absolute minimum that this Ranked Stat is allowed to decay to in ranks.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The lowest level this stat can decay to based on the associated highest level reached.

TunableEnum.name: min_lod_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum Sim info LOD necessary for this information to persist on the sim info. e.g. A statistic tuned to FULL will not persist on sims that are lower than FULL. LOD order, high to low, is FULL, INTERACTED, BASE, BACKGROUND, MINIMUM.

Tunable.name: persisted_tuning
Tunable.description: Whether this statistic will persist when saving a Sim or an object. For example, a Sims's SI score statistic should never persist.

Tunable.name: rank_down_inclusive
Tunable.description: If True, rank-down will occur when the stat value hits the threshold boundary between ranks. Otherwise, rank down will use the default behavior and rank down once the threshold is crossed. For example: a ranked stat has two levels, level 1 with a range of 0-10, level 2 with a range of 10-20, and the current value and level are 15 and 2. If the stat was decremented by 5, setting the value to exactly the threshold boundary of 10, inclusive rules will calculate the new level as 1, whereas exclusive rules will calculate the level as 2. Exclusive rank-downs are the default behavior.

TunableList.name: rank_down_notification_tuning
TunableList.description: A mapping of Rank to tuning needed to display all the notifications when a Sim ranks down. The number of notifications tuned must match the number of items in rank_tuning.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A Tuple containing both the rank down screen slam and the rank down notification to display.

TunableVariant.name: rank_down_notification
TunableVariant.description: The notification to display when the Sim obtains this rank. The text will be provided two tokens: the Sim owning the stat and a number representing the 1-based rank level.

Make sure to avoid having multiple stings play simultaneously.***

TunableVariant.description: A sting to play at the same time as the screen slam. ***Some screen slams may appear to play a sting, but the audio is actually tuned on something else. Example: On CareerLevel tuning there already is a tunable, Promotion Audio Sting, to trigger a sting, so one is not necessary on the screen slam. Make sure to avoid having multiple stings play simultaneously.***

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TdescFragTag.name: show_notification_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that must be true when the we want to show notification.

Tunable.name: respect_lod_on_add
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will not add the statistic if the LOD value of the Sim is lower than the required LOD of the statistic. Otherwise instanced Sims will be allowed to get statistics of higher LOD values.

Tunable.name: send_stat_update_for_npcs
Tunable.description: If checked then whenever we attempt to send the ranked stat update message it will be sent, even if the Sim is an NPC. NOTE: We don't want to mark very many of the stats like this. This is being done to make sure that Fame gets sent so we don't have to request Fame when building the tooltip for sims which could be really slow.

Tunable.name: starting_rank_display_value
Tunable.description: The rank of the stat when it is first added. Used for display before the stat has been initialized. The starting rank is derived from the tuned event intervals and the threshold that corresponds to the stat's initial value.

TunableTuple.name: stat_asm_param
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that defines how this skill and the various skill levels are set on animations played by the Sim. If an animator wants to play different clips to indicate skill progression, use this tuning to pass that data to the ASM. If the clips are part of an interaction ASM, you can tune the 'Animation Stat' field on the SI to determine which skill is used to represent progression. If the clips are part of various types of ASMs, such as posture transitions or 'Get/Put' animations, check the 'Always Apply' checkbox, which will always set the paramter on all animations played by the Sim. If doing so, ensure the parameter name is unique, i.e. includes the skill's name.

Tunable.name: always_apply
Tunable.description: If checked, this parameter is always applied on any ASM involving the owning Sim.

Tunable.name: asm_param_name
Tunable.description: The asm param name.

TunableList.name: level_ranges
TunableList.description: The value mapping of the stat range to stat value or user value. If use_user_value is True, the range should be user value, otherwise stat value.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The asm parameter for Sim's stat level.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Stat value fall into the range (inclusive).

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: use_effective_skill_level
Tunable.description: If true, the effective skill level of the Sim will be used for the asm_param.

Tunable.name: use_user_value
Tunable.description: Whether use the user value or stat value to decide the asm_param.

Tunable.name: stat_name
Tunable.description: Localized name of this statistic.

TunableList.name: tags
TunableList.description: The associated categories of the ranked statistic.

Tunable.name: telemetry
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will support telemetry (GAME:STAT:CHNG) for when statistic is changed. For continuous statistics, will be sent when statistic gets updated.

TunableVariant.name: ui_flyaway_string
TunableVariant.description: If assigned, this will be the string used to trigger a flyaway on the UI when the value of this ranked stat changes.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: visible
Tunable.description: Whether or not statistic should be sent to client. NOTE: Please work with your UI engineering partner to determine if this should be True. If False, for performance reasons, the stat will be removed from the sim if their current value matches the default convergence value. NOTE: If this is left false, then we do NOT support using initial loots above. If you need this to be false but also want an initial loot, then whatever is triggering this statistic will need to handle whatever loot. This is to prevent us continually giving the loot as this decays and gets readded. Since we do not remove the stat if this is set to true this problem doesn't exist and initial loots are allowed.

Tunable.name: zero_out_on_lock
Tunable.description: If checked, when this ranked stat is locked it will zero out the value, highest_level, and bucks.

Tunable.name: zero_point
Tunable.description: The value of the statistic that represents no progress. Values less than the zero-point value represent negative progress. Values greater than the zero-point value represent positive progress.
